trans-unit.source: Provides a type converter to convert <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange"></xref> objects to and from various other types.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> class represents a single date or a range of dates.
This class is commonly associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control, where it represents the selected and highlighted dates.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter> class is an adjunct class to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> that enables you to convert to and from other types, most often strings.

For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class, [Generalized Type Conversion](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/49253ae6-7657-4810-82ab-1176a6feeada), and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/90373a3f-d8c8-492d-841c-945d62393c56).
You should never create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter>.
Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class.
For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter"></xref> class.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter.%23ctor%2A> is the default constructor supplied by the compiler.
You should never create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter>.
Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class.
For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.
Determines if this converter can convert an object of the specified source type to the native type of the converter by querying the supplied type descriptor context.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter> class is specialized to convert between the types <xref:System.String> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange>.
As a result, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter.CanConvertFrom%2A> method returns `true` if the `sourceType` parameter is of type <xref:System.String>.

Otherwise, it defers the call to the base implementation of this method, <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CanConvertFrom%28System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext%2CSystem.Type%29?displayProperty=fullName>.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
The source <xref href="System.Type"></xref> to be converted.
`true` if the converter can perform the specified conversion; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object to the specified destination type by using the specified context.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter.CanConvertTo%2A> method returns `true` if the `destinationType` parameter is of type <xref:System.String> or <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor>.

Otherwise, it defers the call to the base implementation of this method, <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CanConvertTo%28System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext%2CSystem.Type%29?displayProperty=fullName>.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
The destination <xref href="System.Type"></xref> to convert into.
`true` if this converter can perform the specified conversion; otherwise, `false`.
Converts the specified value to the converter's native type by using the specified locale.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> method is specialized to convert <xref:System.String> values that represent a range of dates to their <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> representations.
Types other than <xref:System.String> are passed to the base class implementation of this method.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
The locale information for the conversion.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to convert.
An that represents the converted value.
value is of type but could not be parsed into two strings representing dates.
value is of type that was parsed into two strings, but the conversion of one or both into the type did not succeed.
Converts the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter"></xref> object to another type by using the specified culture.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter.ConvertTo%2A> method is specialized to convert <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> values to their <xref:System.String> or <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor> representations.
Other types are passed to the base class implementation of this method.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
The locale information for the conversion.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to convert.
The destination <xref href="System.Type"></xref> to convert into.
An that represents the converted value.
destinationType is `null`.
value cannot be converted to the destinationType.
Creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange"></xref> object by using the specified type descriptor and set of property values for that object.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter.CreateInstance%2A> method to make changes to an existing immutable object by creating a modified version of it.
This method expects the `propertyValues` parameter to have elements with key values of `Start` and `End`, each with the corresponding <xref:System.DateTime> value.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> that contains the new property values.
If successful, the newly created <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange"></xref>; otherwise, this method throws an exception.
propertyValues is `null` or its Start and End elements could not be converted into a .
Determines if changing a value on an instance should require a call to <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter.CreateInstance*"></xref> to create a new value.
The default implementation always returns `true`.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
`true` if <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter.CreateInstance*"></xref> must be called to make a change to one or more properties; otherwise `false`.
Returns the set of filtered properties for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange"></xref> type

The default implementation of this method does not use the `context` or `value` parameters, but simply refers the call to the TypeDescriptor.<xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetProperties%28System.Type%2CSystem.Attribute%5B%5D%29?displayProperty=fullName> method.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that specifies the type of array for which to get properties.
An array of type <xref href="System.Attribute"></xref> that is used as a filter.
If successful, the set of properties that should be exposed for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange"></xref> type; otherwise, `null`.
Determines whether the current object supports properties that use the specified type descriptor context.
The default implementation always returns `true`.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.

`true` if <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter.GetProperties*"></xref> can be called to find the properties of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange"></xref> object; otherwise, `false`.
